info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 12:51AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Traverse, northern Big Stone and central Roberts Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 151 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Peever, or 8 miles southeast of Sisseton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Browns Valley around 200 AM CDT. Lake Traverse Housing Units and Yankeetown around 205 AM CDT. Beardsley and Traverse Country Park around 210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rainbow Island, Barry, Siloah Country Church, Big Stone Colony, Graceville, Collis and Dumont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
